summary: An FBI Special Agent forwards an internal email regarding a request from Jeffrey Epstein's counsel for evidence items related to Epstein's death investigation. The email notes coordination with the SDNY civil unit and confirms the FBI's position not to take action on the request.

persons.name: Steven Kochevar
persons.context: An AUSA at SDNY in the civil unit who contacted the FBI regarding a letter from Epstein's counsel requesting evidence related to Epstein's death investigation.

persons.name: Kelly
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent who sent the email, working on the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force, providing a heads-up about the request from Epstein's counsel.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the death investigation; his counsel sent a letter requesting various evidence items.

connections.description: Kochevar contacted Kelly to coordinate responses to a legal request from Epstein's counsel regarding the death investigation.
Kochevar, as an AUSA, is involved in responding to a request from Epstein's counsel related to Epstein's death investigation.
Kelly, as an FBI Special Agent on the Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking Task Force, is involved in matters related to Epstein's death investigation.

events.title: Letter from Epstein's counsel received
events.description: Epstein's counsel sent a letter requesting various evidence items surrounding Epstein's death investigation.

events.title: Coordination between SDNY and FBI
events.description: AUSA Steven Kochevar contacted the FBI to verify no action was taken on Epstein's counsel's request and that SDNY would provide the formal response.

keyFacts: Epstein's counsel sent a letter requesting evidence items related to Epstein's death investigation, indicating ongoing legal proceedings post-mortem.
The SDNY civil unit, via AUSA Steven Kochevar, coordinated with the FBI to ensure a unified response, with SDNY handling the formal reply.
The FBI, represented by Special Agent Kelly, confirmed they did not intend to take action on the request from Epstein's counsel.
The email highlights inter-agency communication regarding sensitive evidence in the Epstein case following his death.
